page.title: 14COLLEGE & TOWN RELATIONS
page.content:
Marlborough College, the well-known public school, was started in the 1830's for the sons of Anglican clergymen. Set at one end of the High St., it gives the town a lot of its character, as well as boosting the hotel trade.
There are many links with the town that are mutually beneficial. The Marlborough Squash Club flourishes in the College squash courts and a recently completed pool provides facilities for town and college alike. On Wednesday afternoon several pupils from the college involve themselves in social service projects within the town, varying from tending the gardens of the pensioners in Marlborough to helping in the local primary school.
